thread.title: All-Metro Players of the Week – Week 8
thread.title_full: All-Metro Players of the Week – Week 8

title: All-Metro Players of the Week – Week 8
text:
All-Metro Players of the Week – Week 8 Ethan Bernal , Montgomery Advertiser 6:34 p.m. CDT October 11, 2015 Buy Photo Park Crossing quarterback Malik Cunningham looks for a receiver. Park Crossing takes on Carver on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015, at Cramton Bowl in Montgomery. (Photo: Shannon Heupel/Advertiser) Buy Photo 
A couple of quarterbacks led their teams to rivalry wins, while a receiver continues to put up big numbers. Here’s who was selected as the Advertiser All-Metro Players of the Week for Week 8 (Oct. 8-9). 
CLASS 5A-7A 
Malik Cunningham, QB, Jr., Park Crossing 
Cunningham completed 15-of-25 passes for 241 yards and fourth touchdowns in the Thunderbirds’ 48-27 victory over G.W. Carver. He also ran 14 times for 63 yards and a touchdown. Buy Photo 
Montgomery Academy quarterback Barton Lester runs against Trinity at the Montgomery Academy campus in Montgomery Al. on Friday September 25, 2015. (Photo: Mickey Welsh / Advertiser) 
CLASS 1A-4A 
Barton Lester, QB, Sr., Montgomery Academy 
Lester completed 7-of-9 passes for 107 yards and three touchdowns in the Eagles’ 35-26 victory over Midfield. He added 12 carries for 145 yards and a touchdown on the ground. 
Montgomery Academy (6-1) hosts Central Coosa on Friday. Buy Photo 
Edgewood's Jackson Tate runs against Macon East at the Macon East Academy campus in Cecil, Ala. on Thursday October 1, 2015. (Photo: Mickey Welsh / Advertiser) 
AISA 
Jackson Tate, WR, Jr., Edgewood 
Tate caught eight passes for 227 yards and two touchdowns in the Wildcats’ 61-16 victory over Northside Methodist. 
Edgewood (8-0) travels to Springwood on Friday. 
*The All-Metro Players of the Week are selected based on Advertiser game coverage and statistics submitted by team coaches Read or Share this story: http://on.mgmadv.com/1LpQmzg TOP VIDEOS
